content: I and other FHIR/HL7 leadership will be in China for MedInfo 2017 in August. Does HL7 china want to take advantage of that in any way?
Your messages have been forwarded to the community.
08.18 - 08.20 HL7 Asia and HL7 China Users Conference will also be in Hangzhou, the same city. And HL7 CN would invite you as a keynote speaker.
Thanks. I'm talking to Simon now.
Great although I don't know who is Simon ;)
Simon Gong, Orion (NZ/China - was at our meeting in Zhuhai)
Thanks. I am just thinking of him and looking up my contact book :)
@Grahame Grieve It is a great opportunity for China FHIR community. Who else in FHIR core team will be there?
Viet Nguyen is coming, and from HL7 management, Chuck Jaffe and Stan Huff
Wow…Great!
hey - do we want to do a connectathon when I come?
I should be able to help with that...

If it helps, there's a seminar I've given (and will be repeating a couple of times in the next couple of months) aimed at the clinician / business analyst and includes a general presentation on FHIR, with practical exercises using clinFHIR on clinical topics... Probably a days worth...
I already proposed that to HL7 china community. ;)
you going to be there?
Ｉ hope so. I need to talk to HL7 China for travel arrangement.
@Grahame Grieve @David Hay HL7 china is planning a Connectathon at Aug 18th. Do you plan to do presentation at the Connectathon?
I have been asked to be present and present at the HL7 china meeting that date. I don't recall agreeing on exact presentations/subjects, and I'm not sure whether event = connectathon in this case
but i will do whatever HL7 china asks, of course

Hi Yunwei - At this stage I think I am coming (though not yet confirmed - will need to check with Simon). Like Grahame, I will do whatever you guys want me to do, but one option to consider is a 1 day seminar that I've been working on for people new to FHIR - especially clinicians and analysts, but also suits techies. Combines presentations and exercises for the attendee using the clinFHIR tooling that we've been working on, and seems quite well received on the occasions I've given it. Can make it shorter if needed, though will obviously need to cut stuff out if I do that)
btw, Dan Vreeman (LOINC) is coming to medinfo too - you might invite him to speak at Hl7 china event too
A couple of more questions - HL7 meeting is also in Hangzhou, yes? And does anyone know when medinfo will release a detailed program?
1) Yes
2) Don't know. I will forward your question to Medinfo organizer
